  • Constructor Details

    • Enquiry

      public Enquiry(String applicantNric, String projectName, String enquiryText, Date enquiryDate)
      Constructs a new Enquiry object when an applicant submits it. Automatically generates a unique enquiry ID (e.g., "ENQ1", "ENQ2", ...). Initializes reply fields to null.
      Parameters:
      applicantNric - The NRIC of the applicant submitting the enquiry. Cannot be null.
      projectName - The name of the project the enquiry is about. Cannot be null.
      enquiryText - The text content of the enquiry. Cannot be null or empty.
      enquiryDate - The date the enquiry was submitted. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is invalid (null or empty text).

    • Enquiry

      public Enquiry(String enquiryId, String applicantNric, String projectName, String enquiryText, String replyText, String repliedByNric, Date enquiryDate, Date replyDate)
      Constructs an Enquiry object when loading data from storage. Allows setting all fields, including the ID, reply details, and dates. Updates the static `nextId` counter based on the loaded ID to prevent future collisions.
      Parameters:
      enquiryId - The unique ID of the enquiry being loaded. Cannot be null.
      applicantNric - The NRIC of the applicant. Cannot be null.
      projectName - The name of the project. Cannot be null.
      enquiryText - The text content of the enquiry. Cannot be null.
      replyText - The text of the reply (can be null if not replied).
      repliedByNric - The NRIC of the staff member who replied (can be null).
      enquiryDate - The date the enquiry was submitted. Cannot be null.
      replyDate - The date the reply was submitted (can be null).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if required fields (ID, NRIC, project, text, enquiry date) are null.

  • Method Details

    • updateNextId

      public static void updateNextId(String loadedEnquiryId)
      Static helper method called during loading to update the `nextId` counter. Ensures that newly generated IDs will be greater than any loaded ID. Parses the numeric part of the loaded ID (e.g., "123" from "ENQ123"). Synchronized to handle potential concurrency if loading were multi-threaded (though currently unlikely).
      Parameters:
      loadedEnquiryId - The enquiry ID string loaded from storage.

    • finalizeNextIdInitialization

      public static void finalizeNextIdInitialization()
      Static method to be called once after all enquiries have been loaded. Prints the final value of the `nextId` counter for informational purposes.

    • getEnquiryId

      public String getEnquiryId()
      Gets the unique ID of the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The enquiry ID string (e.g., "ENQ1").

    • getApplicantNric

      public String getApplicantNric()
      Gets the NRIC of the applicant who submitted the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The applicant's NRIC string.

    • getProjectName

      public String getProjectName()
      Gets the name of the project the enquiry is associated with.
      Returns:
      The project name string.

    • getEnquiryText

      public String getEnquiryText()
      Gets the text content of the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The enquiry text string.

    • getReplyText

      public String getReplyText()
      Gets the text content of the reply, if any.
      Returns:
      The reply text string, or null if not replied.

    • getRepliedByNric

      public String getRepliedByNric()
      Gets the NRIC of the staff member who replied, if any.
      Returns:
      The replier's NRIC string, or null if not replied.

    • getEnquiryDate

      public Date getEnquiryDate()
      Gets the date the enquiry was submitted.
      Returns:
      The enquiry submission date.

    • getReplyDate

      public Date getReplyDate()
      Gets the date the reply was submitted, if any.
      Returns:
      The reply submission date, or null if not replied.

    • setEnquiryText

      public boolean setEnquiryText(String enquiryText)
      Sets the enquiry text. Can only be done if the enquiry has not yet been replied to. Ensures the new text is not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      enquiryText - The new enquiry text.
      Returns:
      true if the text was successfully updated, false otherwise (already replied or invalid text).

    • setReply

      public boolean setReply(String replyText, String repliedByNric, Date replyDate)
      Sets the reply details for this enquiry. Marks the enquiry as replied. Ensures reply text, replier NRIC, and reply date are not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      replyText - The text content of the reply.
      repliedByNric - The NRIC of the staff member providing the reply.
      replyDate - The date the reply was submitted.
      Returns:
      true if the reply details were successfully set, false otherwise (invalid parameters).

    • isReplied

      public boolean isReplied()
      Checks if this enquiry has been replied to. An enquiry is considered replied if the `replyText` is not null and not empty.
      Returns:
      true if the enquiry has a reply, false otherwise.
